intro: Ranunculus perelegans, commonly known as the noble buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers with multiple petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, featuring heart-shaped leaves and bright yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Ranunculus perelegans is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
